trans-unit.source: Used for weakly typed query scenarios.
For more information about methods, see <xref:System.Data.Linq.Table%601>.
Attaches an entity to the <xref href="System.Data.Linq.DataContext"></xref> in an unmodified state.

For more information about how to use this method, see [Data Retrieval and CUD Operations in N-Tier Applications (LINQ to SQL)](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/linq/data-retrieval-and-cud-operations-in-n-tier-applications.md).
The entity to be attached.
Attaches all entities of a collection to the <xref href="System.Data.Linq.DataContext"></xref> in either a modified or unmodified state.

For more information about how to use this method, see [Data Retrieval and CUD Operations in N-Tier Applications (LINQ to SQL)](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/linq/data-retrieval-and-cud-operations-in-n-tier-applications.md).
The collection of entities.
`true` to attach the entities as modified.
Attaches an entity to the <xref href="System.Data.Linq.DataContext"></xref> in either a modified or unmodified state by specifying both the entity and its original state.

For more information about how to use this method, see [Data Retrieval and CUD Operations in N-Tier Applications (LINQ to SQL)](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/linq/data-retrieval-and-cud-operations-in-n-tier-applications.md).
The entity to be attached.
An instance of the same entity type with data members that contain the original values.
Attaches all entities of a collection to the <xref href="System.Data.Linq.DataContext"></xref> in either a modified or unmodified state.

For more information about how to use this method, see [Data Retrieval and CUD Operations in N-Tier Applications (LINQ to SQL)](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/linq/data-retrieval-and-cud-operations-in-n-tier-applications.md).
The collection of entities.
Attaches all entities of a collection to the <xref href="System.Data.Linq.DataContext"></xref> in either a modified or unmodified state.

For more information about how to use this method, see [Data Retrieval and CUD Operations in N-Tier Applications (LINQ to SQL)](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/linq/data-retrieval-and-cud-operations-in-n-tier-applications.md).
The collection of entities.
`true` to attach the entities as modified.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.Linq.DataContext"></xref> that has been used to retrieve this <xref href="System.Data.Linq.ITable"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Data.Linq.DataContext"></xref> used to retrieve the <xref href="System.Data.Linq.ITable"></xref>.
Puts all entities from the collection into a `pending delete` state.
Call <xref:System.Data.Linq.DataContext.SubmitChanges%2A> to perform the actual deletion in the database.
The collection from which all items are removed.
Puts an entity from this table into a `pending delete` state.
Disconnected entities must be attached before they can be deleted.
Call <xref:System.Data.Linq.DataContext.SubmitChanges%2A> to perform the actual deletion in the database.
The entity to be removed.
Returns an array of modified members that contain their current and original values.
The entity from which to get the array.
Retrieves original values.
Note the following:
The entity argument must be non-null.
Otherwise, a null argument exception is thrown.
In the case of the strongly typed (`TEntity`) method, the type must be mapped and must be an entity type.
That is, it must have object ID information in its mapping.
Otherwise, a wrong type exception is thrown.
The entity whose original value is to be retrieved.
A copy of the original entity.
The value is null if the entity passed in is not tracked.
Disconnected entities sent back by a client must be attached before the <xref href="System.Data.Linq.DataContext"></xref> can begin to track their state.
The "original state" of a newly attached entity is established based on values supplied by the client.
The data context does not track the state of disconnected entities.
Adds all entities of a collection to the <xref href="System.Data.Linq.DataContext"></xref> in a `pending insert` state.
Call <xref:System.Data.Linq.DataContext.SubmitChanges%2A> to perform the actual insertion into the database.
The entities to add.
Adds an entity in a `pending insert` state to this table.
Call <xref:System.Data.Linq.DataContext.SubmitChanges%2A> to perform the actual insertion into the database.
The entity to be added.
Indicates if the type of the entities contained in this <xref href="System.Data.Linq.ITable"></xref> instance has a primary key.
Returns `true` if the entity type does not have a primary key; otherwise, false.
